etymology.description: Depicts a cowrie shell -> used as currency in ancient China -> stylized as 貝
etymology.interpretation: The character 貝(bèi, 'shell/money') visually represents a cowrie shell, which was used as a form of currency in ancient China. This explains why it is associated with money or valuables.
etymology.simplification: 贝 is a cursive script simplification of 貝, transforming the character into a more streamlined form while retaining its essence.

examples.chinese: 他把贝(貝)当作护身符(護身符)，放在口袋里(口袋裡)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bǎ bèi dāng zuò hùshēn fú, fàng zài kǒudài lǐ.
examples.english: He uses shells as a talisman, placing them in his pocket.

examples.chinese: 古代人用贝作为货币(古代人用貝作為貨幣)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài rén yòng bèi zuòwéi huòbì.
examples.english: In ancient times, people used shells as currency.
